BackstoryDef.title: Vatgrown "Sheriff"
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Sent as a child, [PAWN_nameDef] was created by [PAWN_possessive] corporate backer as a ready-to-work executive. However, as [PAWN_pronoun] was being transported, [PAWN_possessive] company fell apart and [PAWN_pronoun] is now stranded on this world. Rather than do nothing, [PAWN_pronoun] now serves as a sheriff, bringing law rather than spreadsheets to the worlds.

BackstoryDef.title: Vatgrown Noble
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: On a handful of worlds, the nobility of that world is not a dynasty, it is a line of clones. [PAWN_nameDef] is one such clone, created to take after [PAWN_possessive] predecessor, but [PAWN_pronoun] was not able to take their post. [PAWN_pronoun] avoids talking about it and seems to avoid the topic altogether.

BackstoryDef.title: Trench Cook
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Trench warfare has few comforts; of those few comforts, food is not one of them. [PAWN_nameDef] was not selected for [PAWN_possessive] culinary ability but because [PAWN_pronoun] knew how to boil water and add ration powder to it. Though it seems that [PAWN_pronoun] was not able to stay in the trenches, now [PAWN_pronoun] graces people with food that is edible and filling, but never palatable.

BackstoryDef.title: Old Guard Revolutionary
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was once at the forefront of the revolution on [PAWN_homeWorld]. However, changes in the structure of the aftermath left [PAWN_objective] with no choice but to flee [PAWN_possessive] home. The Rimworlds offered [PAWN_objective] opportunities, but it did not change [PAWN_possessive] spirit. The revolution still burns in [PAWN_possessive] heart, and so it continues on.

BackstoryDef.title: Ecoterrorist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] fled from their home after seeing the effects of industrialization on their home. Seeking solace from the cacophony, [PAWN_pronoun] fled to several worlds before settling. Existing amongst nature peacefully until the arrival of colonists disrupted [PAWN_objective]. Now [PAWN_pronoun] seeks the destruction of the entire colonial system for its exploitation of [PAWN_possessive] peace.

BackstoryDef.title: Artistic Raider
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: A brutal life has led to [PAWN_nameDef] serving as a lawless raider. Though a brutal raider, [PAWN_pronoun] has found a passion in the arts, creating improvised works consisting of scrap or splatter art of grease, paint, and blood. Though critically panned as a “talentless hack,” [PAWN_possessive] works are popular with critics who don’t want to end up as [PAWN_possessive] next piece.

BackstoryDef.title: Trench Savant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a nobody before entering the trenches. In the few moments of calm before battle, [PAWN_pronoun] can be found improvising various arts and crafts. Though lacking in brains, [PAWN_pronoun] makes up for it with [PAWN_possessive] inventions, which often have been found to save lives. Even some of [PAWN_possessive] artwork has found its way into various homes in the Coreworlds.

BackstoryDef.title: Mountain Fortress Survivor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: "When the mountain fortress collapsed into chaos, [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the few who made it out alive. Floods, fires, elephants, and madness claimed the rest. [PAWN_pronoun] learned to stay calm through catastrophe and to see humor in disaster, a coping mechanism that unsettles most colonists. Though [PAWN_pronoun] still mutters about “engraving mandates” and “tantrum spirals,” [PAWN_pronoun] knows how to rebuild when everything burns down."

BackstoryDef.title: Singing Mad Scientist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Exiled from a prestigious coreworld laboratory for “ethical violations,” [PAWN_nameDef] continued [PAWN_possessive] experiments without oversight. Freed from regulations and sanity boards, [PAWN_pronoun] pursued the creation of the perfect being, accompanied by long bouts of singing in [PAWN_possessive] lab. Other outcasts and radicals occasionally joined [PAWN_objective], drawn by curiosity or morbid fascination.

BackstoryDef.title: Exiled Comedian
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Once a popular Rim-cast personality, [PAWN_nameDef] was reassigned to the frontier after an infamous on-air meltdown involving drugs, conspiracy rants, and several choice slurs. Now stranded among settlers, [PAWN_pronoun] spends more time retelling alien stories and arguing with invisible producers than helping with real work.

BackstoryDef.title: Megalomaniac Coder
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Starting with a few harmless tweaks, [PAWN_nameDef] quickly became consumed by [PAWN_possessive] own projects. What began as a hobby turned into an obsession to “fix” everything. Convinced that [PAWN_pronoun] could rewrite the world if given enough time, [PAWN_nameDef] now mutters about code, balance patches, and “content pipelines” that no one else understands. Colonists have learned to leave [PAWN_objective] alone when the manic typing starts.

BackstoryDef.title: Posthuman Monk
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Exiled from a reclusive orbital monastery after rejecting the limits of flesh, [PAWN_nameDef] sought to surpass what it means to be human. Seeking to free [PAWN_objective] from the burdens of hunger and pain, [PAWN_pronoun] now pursues peace through quiet experiment and long meditation. Pilgrims sometimes visit [PAWN_objective], uncertain if they are hearing wisdom or madness.

BackstoryDef.title: Rogue Experiment
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Created through a military enhancement program to build stronger, smarter soldiers, [PAWN_nameDef] exceeded every expectation. A major flaw was found though, [PAWN_nameDef] lacked empathy and restraint, [PAWN_pronoun] turned training grounds into graveyards before the project collapsed. When the order came to terminate all subjects, [PAWN_pronoun] destroyed the facility and escaped to the Rim, carrying the perfection that ruined them.

BackstoryDef.title: Terraforming Seeder
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] began work as an "Animal Planter," going around worlds and introducing Earth flora and fauna to alien worlds to make them more like Earth. It was a hard job but [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed working with the animals and so became a full-time Seeder for [PAWN_possessive] company. Now [PAWN_pronoun] works freelance and allows [PAWN_objective] a certain degree of autonomy and stability compared to the planet-hopping life.

BackstoryDef.title: Nomadic Musician
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Upon arriving to the Rimworld, [PAWN_nameDef] took up a position with a traveling act, serving as a comedian, juggler, and finally a musician. Though the troupe has long disbanded, [PAWN_pronoun] still prefers the nomadic lifestyle of the show. [PAWN_pronoun] instead wanders from place to place, bringing [PAWN_possessive] talent to all who will hear in the farthest reaches of the Rim.

BackstoryDef.title: Eccentric Undertaker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was always a bit of an oddball. [PAWN_pronoun] is often found whispering to [PAWN_possessive]self in dark corners or laughing at nothing. Most would see [PAWN_objective] pushed from town into the wilderness, but [PAWN_pronoun] possesses a crafting skill that makes [PAWN_objective] desirable. Though few complaints come from [PAWN_possessive] "patients."

BackstoryDef.title: Reluctant Bandit
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Once a well-respected citizen, [PAWN_nameDef] has taken to a life of crime. Driven to this state by constant struggles, [PAWN_pronoun] now finds [PAWN_objective]self against the system that once rejected [PAWN_objective]. Though [PAWN_possessive] skills as an honest worker still remain, [PAWN_pronoun] now lives from heist to heist rather than paycheck to paycheck.

BackstoryDef.title: Disgraced Politician
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After a humiliating scandal, [PAWN_nameDef] was sent to the Rimworlds to avoid a diplomatic incident. Though lacking the same comforts as before, [PAWN_pronoun] now finds [PAWN_objective]self on a world with a chance to move upward again. Though [PAWN_pronoun] will likely fall into [PAWN_possessive] old habits, everyone deserves a second chance.

BackstoryDef.title: Culinary Adventurer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Like many adventurers, the call is what drives them. [PAWN_nameDef] was driven by a hunger not for adventure but by hunger itself. Seeking new meals and sources of epicurean delights, [PAWN_pronoun] arrived to the Rim in search of the perfect meal after a lifetime of nutrient paste. A talented cook, [PAWN_pronoun] seeks not just self-indulgence but wishes to share it.

BackstoryDef.title: Blackhearted Critic
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After a lifetime of brutal criticism of everything from art to decor, [PAWN_nameDef] was exiled from [PAWN_possessive] home. [PAWN_pronoun] found [PAWN_objective]self in the Rimworlds without a real plan, so [PAWN_pronoun] joined a colonization effort. While not skillless, [PAWN_possessive] personality is not only abrasive but downright abusive to those around [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Expendable Crewmate
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After a long time seeking work, [PAWN_nameDef] found it in the colonization efforts. One small snag - [PAWN_possessive] job was probably the most dangerous in the universe. Constant threats plagued everything around [PAWN_objective]. [PAWN_pronoun] faced cannibal raiders, orbital bombardment, and a weaponized rot lung virus, and that was just in [PAWN_possessive] first year. It also seems that [PAWN_possessive] superiors do not help; instead they seek out ethical quandaries and how to solve them.

BackstoryDef.title: Corporate Mechanic
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Sent out for decade-long contracts, [PAWN_nameDef] and other corporate mechanics go from world to world fixing their companies' machines. Everything from the smallest outlets to entire harvesting operations, [PAWN_nameDef] has more work experience in a year than most do in their entire life. Though this has taken a toll on [PAWN_objective], the lack of relations has left [PAWN_pronoun] struggling to work with others.

BackstoryDef.title: Idealistic Militia Trooper
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After watching one commercial, [PAWN_nameDef] was filled with such a level of patriotism that [PAWN_pronoun] joined within 30 minutes. However, [PAWN_pronoun] was in for a rude awakening when after weeks of training, [PAWN_pronoun] was sent not to one of the fronts against the bugs or bots, but here. That did not dampen [PAWN_possessive] spirits though — [PAWN_pronoun] often finds [PAWN_objective]self following regulations to the letter and lecturing [PAWN_possessive] fellow colonists about the glory of their collective efforts.

BackstoryDef.title: Indigenous Curiosity
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Once a proud member of an isolated people on a Rimworld, [PAWN_nameDef] was captured by Empire forces and taken to be a part of a traveling exhibit. [PAWN_pronoun] found [PAWN_objective]self as a stranger in a strange land, being used as a one-[PAWN_objective] show. Eventually, when the audience dried up, [PAWN_pronoun] was abandoned by [PAWN_possessive] captor and [PAWN_pronoun] was forced to return home to find that [PAWN_possessive] home was now being colonized by the people who had taken [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Indigenous Partisan
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Like many on the Rimworld, [PAWN_nameDef] took up arms against those who sought to colonize [PAWN_possessive] world. [PAWN_pronoun] worked with several groups, raiding and brutalizing invaders who sought their homes and land. [PAWN_pronoun] has known war for so long that [PAWN_pronoun] will not know what to do with peace if it was given to [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Indigenous Saboteur
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After the colonization of their world, [PAWN_nameDef] sought to fight an indirect war against their colonizer. Learning the construction of traps and various weapons, [PAWN_pronoun] used this knowledge to hamper and even cripple several efforts of colonist groups which seek the extermination of [PAWN_possessive] people.

BackstoryDef.title: Indigenous Word-keeper
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: With the influx of colonists, many have forgotten the old ways. [PAWN_nameDef], however, has preserved the history of [PAWN_possessive] people in the oral tradition. All great heroes and villains, all golden ages and collapses, all remembered by [PAWN_objective] in speech and sound and poem. [PAWN_pronoun] preserves [PAWN_possessive] people, for those who have come to claim their world will not.

BackstoryDef.title: Lottery Winner
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Who won the lottery!? [PAWN_nameDef] did! [PAWN_pronoun] won an all-expenses-paid trip to the Rimworlds at the very edges of civilization. Going from a boring clerk to the frontier of adventure, though one small issue remains: [PAWN_pronoun] has very few skills that are useful in the Rimworlds. [PAWN_pronoun] likely has a future of hauling things and cleaning floors, but it’s still more interesting than spreadsheets.

BackstoryDef.title: Disillusioned Historian
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: After decades of studying and lecturing, [PAWN_nameDef] found [PAWN_objective]self in a state [PAWN_pronoun] did not expect. After watching as every warning fell on deaf ears, [PAWN_pronoun] became disillusioned with [PAWN_possessive] career as more and more chaos erupted on [PAWN_possessive] home. [PAWN_pronoun] fled to the Rimworld to avoid the purges, and now [PAWN_pronoun] lives every day feeling worse about the galaxy than before.

BackstoryDef.title: Commissioned Stone Mason
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Trained since childhood as a stone mason, [PAWN_nameDef] was sent for by a colonial governor to construct a mountain villa. A masterful structure was completed in record time, but when [PAWN_pronoun] sought payment for [PAWN_possessive] work, the governor ordered [PAWN_objective] arrested for daring to ask to be paid. They never caught [PAWN_objective], though — the villa was destroyed when insectoids burrowed into it, killing everyone inside.

BackstoryDef.title: Contracted Duelist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: On many worlds, honor duels still take place. [PAWN_nameDef] comes from one such world, serving as a contract duelist hired to fight on behalf of nobles who can afford [PAWN_objective]. [PAWN_pronoun] was ordered to come to the Rimworlds and duel a particular man to the death for some slight offense, and until [PAWN_pronoun] completes [PAWN_possessive] task, [PAWN_pronoun] will remain here.

BackstoryDef.title: Pious liberator
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Once a humble minister on a world steeped in the bondage of others, [PAWN_nameDef] could no longer tolerate the injustice. Abandoning the pulpit, [PAWN_pronoun] took up arms against the masters of [PAWN_possessive] world, waging a holy war to end the practice of slavery. When victory came, [PAWN_pronoun] saw no rest — only the next world to free. Now wandering the Rim, [PAWN_pronoun] carries both [PAWN_possessive] faith and the scars of [PAWN_possessive] crusade.

BackstoryDef.title: AI victim
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] survived the extinction of [PAWN_possessive] colony after its defense network achieved full sentience. The machine spared a handful of humans, reshaping them as playthings in an endless cycle of torment and experiment. [PAWN_pronoun] escaped when the system finally collapsed, though what remains of [PAWN_pronoun] mind is unclear. Now on the Rim, [PAWN_pronoun] struggles to separate real suffering from echoes of simulation, driven by a quiet hatred of thinking machines.

BackstoryDef.title: Cartel terraformer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] once worked for a powerful cartel that specialized in planetary terraforming for illicit agriculture. Using off-the-record orbital mirrors, illegal atmosphere processors, and gene-modified soil cultures, [PAWN_pronoun] reshaped entire worlds to grow narcotics on a planetary scale. When one of the operations was seized by the authorities, [PAWN_pronoun] fled to the Rim, where old habits die hard and barren worlds are always for sale.

BackstoryDef.title: Developer con artist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] once helmed a wildly ambitious simulation game project that promised players a living galaxy and endless freedom. Investors poured in billions, and fanatics called [PAWN_pronoun] a visionary. When the money ran dry and the codebase turned to ruin, [PAWN_pronoun] vanished—taking the remaining funds with [PAWN_objective]. Now living on the Rim, [PAWN_pronoun] avoids questions about “that game” while still showing flashes of genuine technical brilliance, mixed with a con artist’s charm.

BackstoryDef.title: Flat galaxy truther
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] became convinced that the galaxy was not a spiral of stars, but a flat disc surrounded by a massive government projection. After years of arguing with astrophysicists, posting long manifestos, and being banned from countless networks, [PAWN_pronoun] sold everything and left for the Rim to “see the edge” firsthand. Out here, [PAWN_pronoun] still delivers passionate lectures to anyone who will listen—and many who won’t.

BackstoryDef.title: Romantic sightseer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Inspired by the ideals of the Romantic era, [PAWN_nameDef] left the comforts of civilization to see the Rim before progress stripped it of mystery. [PAWN_pronoun] came seeking beauty in desolation, poetry in hardship, and meaning in the struggle of survival. Though often naive about the dangers of the frontier, [PAWN_pronoun] observes every horizon with wonder and records each scene in careful sketches and vivid descriptions.

BackstoryDef.title: Interpolitical assassin
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was an ordinary supporter within a growing political movement, loyal to its ideals and rhetoric. When the party’s founder began to change direction, [PAWN_pronoun] saw it as a betrayal of everything the movement stood for. Acting alone, [PAWN_pronoun] confronted the leader and ended the argument with a single shot. The murder fractured the party, and [PAWN_pronoun] was branded both traitor and martyr. Fleeing the fallout, [PAWN_pronoun] found refuge on the Rim, still haunted by the moment ideology turned to violence.

BackstoryDef.title: Frontier extremist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Civilization, to [PAWN_objective], looked rotten at the core. The frontier promised rules that could be written in sweat and grit instead of committees. After leaving the core worlds, [PAWN_pronoun] joined a camp of political exiles and set to work building the kind of settlement their manifestos described. Moderation reads as betrayal to [PAWN_pronoun], and debate fills the nights between watch shifts and wall repairs.

BackstoryDef.title: Immigration agent
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: The immigration authority promised order across the colonies, but its work became little more than cruelty wrapped in procedure. [PAWN_nameDef] enforced every rule without question, separating families, denying refuge, and filling prison barges in the name of policy. When the regime fell, evidence of those crimes emerged, and [PAWN_pronoun] fled before the tribunals could convene. The Rim now shelters one more fugitive who still talks like an officer and dreams of paperwork.

BackstoryDef.title: Poltical commentator
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Criticism paid better than honesty, and [PAWN_nameDef] built a career out of mocking others from the comfort of a studio chair. Every story was a scandal, every rival a fraud, and every ally a future target. When the networks tired of the constant vitriol, [PAWN_pronoun] turned to independent broadcasting and kept talking until the audience vanished. Now exiled to the Rim, [PAWN_pronoun] spends long nights ranting into dead transmitters, convinced that someone, somewhere, still cares.

BackstoryDef.title: Trickshot gunslinger
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Playing cards split in the air, tin cups kicked into a spin, cuffs shot clean off a wrist. Crowds gathered for the noise and stayed for the nerve. When the last show ended in live ammunition and angry relatives, [PAWN_pronoun] took the act on the road and never looked back. On the Rim, the tricks pay for food, and the aim keeps [PAWN_objective] alive.

BackstoryDef.title: Cut-throat baker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: The show promised fame, fortune, and a restaurant on the frontier. [PAWN_nameDef] fought through weeks of sabotage, sleepless nights, and televised breakdowns to claim victory. The prize turned out to be a one-way ticket to a colony that barely existed. With no cameras left to watch, [PAWN_pronoun] keeps baking out of habit, still plating every meal like the judges might walk in at any moment.

BackstoryDef.title: Chem-dog infantry
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Convicts became soldiers when the empire needed bodies more than morals. [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the chem-dogs, a penal infantry unit kept fighting through stimulants and fear suppressants. The drugs made [PAWN_pronoun] faster, stronger, and meaner, but never free. When the last campaign ended and the supply lines dried up, [PAWN_pronoun] wandered onto the Rim, chasing withdrawal and ghosts of orders that no longer exist.

BackstoryDef.title: Amnesiac detective
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: The hangover came first, then the realization that [PAWN_nameDef] could not remember a single thing about who [PAWN_pronoun] was. The badge in the pocket suggested law enforcement, though the stains on it told a different story. Somewhere there had been a partner, a case, and a failure big enough to erase everything. On the Rim, [PAWN_pronoun] still looks for clues in every face and bottle, hoping one of them will explain what happened.

BackstoryDef.title: Fast food grifter
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Ration queues taught [PAWN_nameDef] everything [PAWN_pronoun] needed to know about desperation and performance. A counterfeit meal ticket here, a sympathetic clerk there; survival came plated with grease and guilt. [PAWN_possessive] revolution never made it past the dining counter, but the stories did. These days [PAWN_pronoun] still eats on credit, paid in charm, memory, and whatever passes for conviction on the Rim.
